translated: The Sutra of a Hundred Parables in GÄthÄs for Transforming the World through Supreme Military Might
Jalandhara in Central India, in the Western Heaven, at the monastery of the dense forest
Tripiá¹­aka master, Bright Teaching Grand Master, purple-robed Å›ramaá¹‡a subject
The past sages, their bodies and so forth, all spoke without exception the scriptural passages and phrases,
I now sing myself, delighting in foolish thoughts, briefly reciting a hundred parables in gÄthÄs.
Practicing kindness, righteousness, and virtuous conduct, without self, arrogance, or cowardice,
True compassion can be respected as a teacher, capable of practicing the superior person's way of liberation.
Although poor and humble, preserve a firm will; even if the body becomes wealthy and noble, still be gentle and yielding,
If encountering a strong enemy, be brave and strong; this is then called the characteristic of a great person.
Youthful practice of goodness is rare; when people come to ask, joyfully give to them,
If people praise me, I am ashamed to hear it; such people are also difficult to find.
If one wishes for a good reputation, first seek the Dharma; the essence of the Dharma naturally produces virtue.
Upholding all precepts and practices with utmost sincerity, such a person is extremely rare in the world.
Naturally virtuous and speaking virtuously, knowing well the virtuous and the wicked,
Concealing others' faults, such wise people are difficult to find in the world.
The nature of fire is warm and hot by itself, the nature of the moon is clear and cool as well.
The Ká¹£atriya caste is renowned as the best, why should the lower castes be strange?
Relatives in difficulty must be rescued, others in difficulty are the same.
Exhausting one's strength for others, with no second thought, this is called right livelihood in the midst of life.
Generosity, patience, and the power of wisdom, taming the senses and speaking well,
This is the true adornment of the noble ones, adorning with gold and jewels is like carrying a burden.
That is not destroyed by impermanence and emptiness,ğŸ”½Only the virtues of the unconditioned and tranquil,
Can remain forever through the kalpas.ğŸ”½Excellent, with a well-proportioned and upright body,
And endowed with the radiance of virtuous conduct,ğŸ”½Like the bright moon in the sky,
The pure light illuminates the palace.ğŸ”½The wealthy and noble practice generosity for all people,
Their minds accomplish boundless Dharma,ğŸ”½With courage and strength, they rescue the weak,
Excellent, these virtues are truly good.ğŸ”½The virtuous respect virtue and have compassion for those without virtue,
The foolish belittle virtue and abandon it,ğŸ”½The wise are like the red sun emitting fiery light,
The foolish are like the starlight that obscures the radiance.ğŸ”½The wise can protect themselves from all faults,
Single-mindedly cultivating virtue to lofty heights,ğŸ”½If one indulges the mind and commits a single fault when young,
Many accumulated virtues are also lost.
Evil people are far removed from the virtue of precepts, always wanting to be close to unwholesome people,
Like abandoning a cool and virtuous pond, and entering turbid and impure water.
When oil is applied to the body, it must remove dirt; after removing dirt, the oil must be washed off again,
Like when doing things, one must accomplish the goal; if the goal is accomplished, one should stop what one is doing.
Evil people are always evil, likened to a black snake; evil people are confused and unrestrained, like a drunken elephant,
Good people are frightened and hurt, while evil people are delighted in the opposite way.
A great fire raging in the sky is difficult to extinguish; a deep abyss with no bottom is impossible to know,
If one carefully observes dangerous and evil things with wisdom, one will deeply believe in good things without doubt or slander.
Falling off a cliff or into a fire is extremely dangerous, but one may survive and rise again,
If a person falls into the evil realms, it is like a deep spring in the evil realms, from which one cannot emerge.
The great flood and turbulent waves cannot carry it away, the great blazing fire cannot burn it,
The strong and evil robbers cannot steal it, it is the supreme wealth in the world.
Inferior people rely on having wealth, middling people have nothing to rely on,
Middling people see wealth and are slightly delighted, inferior people rely on wealth as the best in the world.
All kinds of clans, forms, and virtues, shared practices, relatives, and friends,
One by one, they do not know where they come from, they only strive for greed, foolishness, and the benefits of wealth.
The rich speak falsely, but people take it as true, the poor speak truthfully, but it is considered wrong,
Flattery, deception, and reliance without true practice, the wise and virtuous people hear and feel ashamed.
Having wealth, power, and nobility but lacking virtue, it is like having virtue and being praised,
Lacking wealth, being poor and lowly but having complete virtuous conduct, the ignorant and unknowing slander and defame instead.
Heroic virtue and conduct are as if nonexistent, this is the true contemplation of good people.
Free from wealth, peacefully on the path, dwelling in poverty, relatives slight poverty and truly act falsely.
Butchers are praised for their wealth and nobility, superior people without wealth are considered inferior.
Relatives and friends follow worldly feelings, only serving butchers and liquor sellers, without good or evil.
The multitude knows that evil destinies are perilous and sinking, with a hundred kinds of suffering in the intermediate punishment.
Beggars come and go, hoping for relief, but completely lacking in giving, firmly going against their feelings.
When beggars do not fulfill their feelings, they become angry, harboring resentment and sighing with regret.
This person's mind is hard, stingy with words, not as generous as giving up life.
This person is stingy, foolish, and heavily deluded, completely unaware of the practice of giving to save others.
Hoarded wealth and silk will eventually be scattered and destroyed, but practicing generosity is forever firm and secure.
One person protects many possessions, foolish and deluded, becoming more stingy without any thought,
Experiencing suffering, how can they know the falsity of stinginess? Many people protect objects, suffering is equal.
Not using, not giving to others, completely unaware of this good and beneficial matter,
Gold and silver accumulate filling the house, what is the difference from a pit filled with filth?
The poor practicing giving is true generosity, they are called the supreme person,
The wealthy and noble slightly giving a little wealth, like a drop in the river, who does not understand?
If a person relies on the Dharma and practices without lack, good giving is like good female beauty,
If giving other wealth is practiced intermittently, the resulting fruits will be deficient or abundant in the same way.
The pure field of the mind serves the Dharma King, youth with precepts and virtue likened to the fragrance of flowers,
Compassionate mind and gentleness like a young woman, delightful and adorned, the great practice is fragrant.
Paying homage and visiting sacred sites, practicing generosity, diligently studying, enduring hardships,
If one violates the rules and lacks moral conduct, all the good deeds done before will be wasted.
Now one is renowned and respected by people, in the next life one will be born in the heavens and admired by all,
Blessings and longevity extended far, always joyful and happy, all come from upholding the precepts and accomplishing good deeds.
Always hearing of the extreme suffering of the three evil realms, always guarding one's dignity and moral virtue is complete,
When life ends and one abandons the body, in the evil realms of Yama, I have no fear.
In cities, villages, and forests, some are foolish and deluded, some are wise,
Whether one knows the Dharma or not, if seeking the good and blissful, one must uphold the precepts.
Upholding the precepts purely, always associating with good spiritual friends,
Cultivating wholesome actions according to the Dharma, all merits and virtues are gathered.
Upholding the precepts brings the benefits of peace and happiness. If the mind is foolish and deluded, there will be harm.
Merit and life will perish in an instant. Why would the wise drink alcohol?
If one drinks alcohol, it reveals foolishness and inferiority. Ultimately, it is wrong and has no good reputation.
Suddenly falling down is like impermanence. Being filled with defilements becomes impure.
Although relatives and loved ones drink together, when drunk, they contradict each other and even harm each other's lives.
Such faults arise in an instant. This alcohol poison is worse than poison.
Many offenses are caused by lustful actions. Even if one is willing to die, the mind is still drawn to them.
All lustful desires have no good benefits. Why use foolish delusions to recruit women?
If one enjoys one's own wife and seeks pleasure, it is appropriate to always crave and love her.
If one falsely pursues the wives and concubines of others, one will feel lonely and fearful.
Blood, flesh, sinews, marrow, skin and hide, the body is entirely impure inside and out,
One's own wife and children are not one's own, how much less so the wives of others!
If a person has a pure mind and no lust, knowing that this union is like an illusion or a dream,
Therefore, one should stay far away from women, and one's mind will be at ease, free from delusion and error.
Women are indeed delightful, and so are wealth, nobility, and indulgence,
One's relatives and loved ones, but life is short and impermanent.
Fools increase their greed and love one-sidedly, while the wise contemplate that it is all empty,
If one continues to take pleasure in the objects of desire, when will one escape and attain enlightenment?
In practice, do not be averse to hardship, for later one will reap a body of peace and joy,
This should be good advice and true benefit, practicing it is like taking wonderful medicine.
All matters and practices are mostly clear, and faults and dangers can all be known.
If it is suitable to practice, then it can be practiced. How can good deeds be covered up?
If a person cultivates and creates future events, first removing evil and confusion, and contemplating correctly,
Later on, there will definitely be no faults, and naturally peaceful and free from suffering.
If one cultivates good deeds and causes them to increase, single-mindedly tranquil and free from agitation,
Like having an enemy, afflictive illness, naturally eliminating stupidity and ignorance.
Evil speech, double-tongue, and inferior mind, a foolish person indulges in their own feelings and acts according to their emotions,
How can they know that the peacock's colorful virtues can be compared to the clamor of wolves, dogs, crows, and sparrows?
Reproaching foolishness and ignorance, praising diligence, precepts, and giving,
I say that there are people who practice this way, accumulating blessings, and being most secure in their bodies.
The sound of the Dharma is like singing and music, without delighting in the mind, what else can one rely on?
If you sentient beings abandon it, are you animals or humans?
For the sake of profit or non-profit, you are completely unaware, you do not know the real and the unreal,
Thus, you are in darkness without discrimination, although you have a human form, you are the same as animals.
Not distinguishing the wise and the foolish, how can you discern the jackal from the lion?
All without superiority or inferiority, viewed in the same way, the wise should not stay with them for a moment.
Not speaking of self-realization, not foolish, not engaging in divisive speech, not arrogant,
Difficult to know, there is something to be known above the principles, this is said to be the adornment of the brahmin.
Cultivating true practice with a focused and attentive mind, faults are always not accepted,
Arrogant and evil people give rise to disputes, I do not have such qualities.
Within the foolish mind, there is a harboring of perversity, with no compassion or forbearance, and much ferocity.
With these powerful faults, they take them as their own virtues and surpass others.
Without a heavy mind for the supreme path of leaving the home life, they do not respect and befriend good friends at all.
They have never made offerings to the teacher's teachings, and only associate with fighting and great foolishness.
The full moon in the sky will eventually be incomplete, and the fragrant flowers on the mountain will soon wither.
How is the impermanence of the human world any different from this? What is the use of arguing about our differences?
Women's nature is ultimately without reality, obstructing people's cultivation of good causes.
The Ämalaka fruit has its seeds - these are the three faults of the world.
Respecting the Dharma master and contemplating the holy traces, the mind's activities are content and filled with compassion and wisdom.
These five kinds of worldly matters, if said to be difficult to do, are also easy to do.
If a person knows the Dharma and always does good, and is able to seek out good friends,
It is like picking out true gold from sand; all sentient beings will know its value.
Foolish and inferior companions are not free to act on their own; naturally lacking virtue and knowledge, they are respected.
Even if they renounce the world, they will certainly be violent and evil; even if they manage to survive, they will have no good reputation.
Why do you not believe in friends?
Why do you not know the gods and humans?
Why do you not practice skillful means?
Why do you make it difficult for yourself to learn?
How can a stingy person understand giving?
How can there be water in a quicksand?
How can there be a fragrant smell in impurity?ğŸ”½How can there be kindness and righteousness in an evil person?ğŸ”½How can a hateful person have virtue?
How can there be a good person in an enemy?
How can a happy person know contentment?
How can a person obtain longevity?
Prostitutes are frivolous and have no deep faith, foolish people are dull and have no discernment,
Wealth and nobility are temporarily glorious, who can keep them for long?
The causes of karma are determined and difficult to destroy.
Brahmins are delighted to get food, peacocks are delighted to hear the sound of thunder,
Good people are delighted to rescue others, fools are delighted when they destroy [others].
Fools take pleasure in engaging in disputes, like the poor who are delighted to find treasure,
The wise hear their good words, like bees smelling the fragrance of flowers.
For the virtuous, virtue is their kin, for the guilty, their faults are their enemies,
For the lowly servants, their lowliness is their suffering, for the contented, contentment is their joy.
Why hesitate to go from door to door holding a bowl to collect alms? Why avoid the trouble of working hard in other places?
Never attach the view of self to the body, always tame the mind and practice good and gentle conduct.
With no love in the mind, no self or others, like a deer living in the wild forest,
Dwelling in this wealth and nobility, one should not seek anything from others.
Abandoning false and pleasant conditions, completely unattached and free,
Making a living with a nature like a goose or duck, dwelling long in pure water.
In the royal city and villages where people live, the eight virtues are mostly absent,
Compassion, shame, purity, embarrassment, knowing the Dharma, selflessness, and the power of happiness.
In the mountains, valleys, cliffs, and caves, eating fruits, wearing bark clothes, subduing the five faculties,
The peaceful wild forest is suitable for delight, why seek people in the villages?
Dwelling in the mountains, not seeing others' homes, free and unconstrained, happily practicing,
The benefits obtained in the mind while dwelling there, subduing the faculties, consciousness, and prolonging life.
I now teach and transform you all, listen with palms joined and a disciplined mind,
The treasury of all dharmas is truly blissful, that should be joyfully sought with a one-pointed mind.
You know the good rewards of a single human body, if you want it, it cannot be obtained in a moment,
After obtaining it, the foolish do not create merit, relying on the past, they sink and drown by themselves.
Water drops do not remain on the ground for long, this can be compared to human life being impermanent,
Who can create the three kinds of unobstructed [abilities]? If it is a wise one, only then can they be practiced.
If they are like this, following their abilities, with intention, knowing a little of the three kinds,
It is like a wild dove observing its own body, the peacock's adornments are not superior to me.
Who loves impermanence and birth and death? Wisdom has never observed the five faculties,
Although this body abides, it will never last long, it is said that they are born in vain in the world.
Thus, Yama, people see the end of their lives, and few escape suffering.
There is no place of peace from old age and death, why do you not practice?
Impermanence is certain for all beings, yet you are only greedy for life and do not know,
The road ahead is without support, the light and shadow are swift, why are you so oblivious and do not think?
Parents, wife, children, and friends, are united in illusory and temporary moments,
The true Dharma relatives are worthy of reliance, they can remove the suffering of impermanence and birth and death.
Much seeking brings the reality of afflictions, protecting the body brings the reality of fear,
Destruction brings the reality of sorrow, what benefit is there for the wise to seek?
If they do not cultivate the practice of suchness, when will the cycle of birth and death end?
The wise always observe this world, it is all illusory and foolish power.
Playful words and singing are all unreal, and craving and pursuit are like an itchy scab,
Life is as impermanent as a dream or illusion, how can it compare to using body and mind for the Buddha Dharma?
But all the sins one has committed are equal in destroying one's body,
Why are the minds of people in the world so foolish and dark, not understanding to contemplate the arising of evil?
The matters in the mind, whether good or evil, are all known by the world-protecting gods,
If the mind cannot contemplate this, when will the mind be able to eliminate all sins?
Following conditions, sitting, dwelling, and enjoying the necessities, one can temporarily rely on the body,
These temporary conditions for practicing goodness are troublesome for others,
Although one sees the majestic palace and so forth, it is only a coarse and evil bed and bedding,
Being content and naturally joyful, it is like regarding an ugly woman as superior to a heavenly maiden.
You should know that there are conditioned wealth in the world, which can be taken away by water, fire, thieves, and robbers,
If you seek blessings for the next world in this way, do not seek these unstable wealth.
For discussion, business, agriculture, and farming, do not practice without following the rules,
You should know that this matter is appropriate, apart from blessings, it is not accomplished by nature.
If you can do good and do evil, you should know that it is not done by others,
It is all created by one's own karma, and thus all sentient beings obtain it.
Thus, for all actions done, if you can avoid them later, they will not arise again,
Birth, old age, sickness, suffering, and impermanence, continue without knowing where they come from!
The SÅ«tra of a Hundred Parables on the Transformation of the World by King Prasenajit
